message.content:
cs.IR, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.DB, cs.CL. 

The paper is about large scale document clustering, which is a common task in information retrieval (cs.IR). The K-tree algorithm is an efficient approximation of k-means clustering (cs.DS), and it forms a hierarchy of clusters (cs.LG). The paper also mentions addressing issues with sparse representations, which is a common problem in natural language processing (cs.CL). Finally, the paper discusses disk-based implementations, which is a common concern in database systems (cs.DB).
